headline: Rio Tinto to supply copper to Amazon for AI data centers

AI sector growth is expected to boost global copper demand 50% by 2040, although analysts have warned supplies could fall far ⁠short, sparking a rush to ‌ensure access.

headline: Saks Global obtains court approval for $400 million in rescue financing
summary: STORY: A U.S. bankruptcy judge on Wednesday (January 14) granted initial approval of Saks Global’s bankruptcy financing.It will allow the company to draw on $400 million in new cash despite an objection from Saks' estranged business partner Amazon.com.Saks' chief restructuring officer Mark Weinstein said during the hearing the company would be "dead in the water" without the new money.And plans to use it to pay vendors and the company's 17,000 employees.The luxury retail company filed for bankruptcy on Tuesday with $3.4 billion of debt.That's after its merger with Neiman Marcus caused cash shortfalls that prevented Saks from reliably replenishing inventory at its stores.Saks Global's attorney said stores remain open for business and that the firm has no concern about weakening customer demand.Before approving the bankruptcy loan, the judge overruled an objection by online retail giant Amazon.It had argued its $475 million equity investment in Saks would become "worthless" if the bankruptcy proceeds with the current financing arrangement.Amazon's attorney said at the hearing that it has "little to no confidence" Saks can successfully emerge from bankruptcy.Long loved by the rich and famous, Saks never fully recovered from the COVID pandemic, as competition from online outlets rose.
